org.jtrim.utils

Class ShutdownHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jtrim.utils.ShutdownHelper

  • public final class ShutdownHelper
extends java.lang.Object
    Contains static helper methods for shutting down an application.

    Thread safety

    Unless otherwise noted, methods of this class are safe to use by multiple threads concurrently.

    Synchronization transparency

    Unless otherwise noted, methods of this class are not synchronization transparent.

    • Method Detail

      • haltLater

        public static void haltLater(int status,
             int msToWait)
        Halts the JVM if it does not shutdown after a given timeout. This method may require certain permission from the currently present security manager.

        This method will start a new daemon thread and will attempt to invoke the Runtime.halt method on this daemon thread. Notice, that a daemon thread is started which does not prevent the JVM to shutdown. Also, this method will return immediately regardless of the timeout argument.

        This method is intended to be used as a last resort shutting down if the JVM fails to shutdown when the application believes it should (most likely because of remaining non-daemon threads).

        Parameters:
        status - the int value to be passed to the Runtime.halt method. This value can be anything which is allowed by the currently present security manager.
        msToWait - the milliseconds to wait before actually calling the Runtime.halt method. This argument must be greater than or equal to zero.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - thrown if the specified timeout value is lower than zero
        java.lang.SecurityException - thrown if there is a security manager present and its checkExit method does not allow to terminate with the given status
        See Also:
        exitLater(int, int), exitLater(Runnable, int, int)

      • exitLater

        public static void exitLater(int status,
             int msToWait)
        Exits the JVM if it does not shutdown after a given timeout. This method may require certain permission from the currently present security manager.

        This method will start a new daemon thread and will attempt to invoke the System.exit method on this daemon thread. Notice, that a daemon thread is started which does not prevent the JVM to shutdown. Also, this method will return immediately regardless of the timeout argument.

        This method is intended to be used as a last resort shutting down if the JVM fails to shutdown when the application believes it should (most likely because of remaining non-daemon threads).

        Parameters:
        status - the int value to be passed to the System.exit method. This value can be anything which is allowed by the currently present security manager.
        msToWait - the milliseconds to wait before actually calling the System.exit method. This argument must be greater than or equal to zero.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - thrown if the specified timeout value is lower than zero
        java.lang.SecurityException - thrown if there is a security manager present and its checkExit method does not allow to terminate with the given status
        See Also:
        exitLater(Runnable, int, int), haltLater(int, int)

      • exitLater

        public static void exitLater(java.lang.Runnable exitTask,
             int status,
             int msToWait)
        Exits the JVM if it does not shutdown after a given timeout and executes a given task before shutting down. This method may require certain permission from the currently present security manager.

        The method will start a new non-daemon thread and will execute the task on this thread. After this task completes, it will start a new daemon thread and after the given timeout, it will attempt to invoke the System.exit method on this daemon thread. Notice, that a daemon thread is started which does not prevent the JVM to shutdown. Also, this method will return immediately regardless of the timeout argument.

        This method is intended to be used as a last resort shutting down if the JVM fails to shutdown when the application believes it should (most likely because of remaining non-daemon threads).

        Parameters:
        exitTask - the task to be executed before shutting down the JVM. This argument can be null, in which case no task will be executed.
        status - the int value to be passed to the System.exit method. This value can be anything which is allowed by the currently present security manager.
        msToWait - the milliseconds to wait before actually calling the System.exit method. This argument must be greater than or equal to zero.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - thrown if the specified timeout value is lower than zero
        java.lang.SecurityException - thrown if there is a security manager present and its checkExit method does not allow to terminate with the given status
        See Also:
        exitLater(int, int), haltLater(int, int)

      • exit

        public static void exit(java.lang.Runnable exitTask,
        int status)
        Immediately starts a non-daemon thread, executes the specified task on it and terminates the JVM.
        Parameters:
        exitTask - the task to be executed before shutting down the JVM. This argument can be null, in which case no task will be executed.
        status - the int value to be passed to the System.exit method. This value can be anything which is allowed by the currently present security manager.
        Throws:
        java.lang.SecurityException - thrown if there is a security manager present and its checkExit method does not allow to terminate with the given status

      • shutdownExecutors

        public static void shutdownExecutors(java.util.concurrent.ExecutorService... executors)
        Invokes the shutdown method of the specified executors.
        Parameters:
        executors - the array of executors whose shutdown method is to be called. This argument cannot be null and cannot contain null elements.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - thrown if the specified array is null or contains null elements

      • shutdownNowExecutors

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.Runnable> shutdownNowExecutors(java.util.concurrent.ExecutorService... executors)
        Invokes the shutdownNow method of the specified executors and returns all the tasks returned by these shutdownNow methods in a single list.
        Parameters:
        executors - the array of executors whose shutdownNow method is to be called. This argument cannot be null and cannot contain null elements.
        Returns:
        the list of tasks returned by the shutdownNow methods of the specified executors. This list is the concatenation of the task lists returned by the shutdownNow methods. This method never returns null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - thrown if the specified array is null or contains null elements

      • awaitTerminateExecutorsSilently

        public static void awaitTerminateExecutorsSilently(java.util.concurrent.ExecutorService... executors)
        Waits until all the specified executors terminate or the current thread gets interrupted. In case the current thread gets interrupted, this method returns immediately and keeps the interrupted status of the thread.
        Parameters:
        executors - the executors to wait to be terminated. This argument cannot be null and cannot contain null elements.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - thrown if the specified executor array is null or one of the executors is null
        See Also:
        awaitTerminateExecutors(ExecutorService[])

      • awaitTerminateExecutorsSilently

        public static boolean awaitTerminateExecutorsSilently(long timeout,
                                      java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit timeunit,
                                      java.util.concurrent.ExecutorService... executors)
        Waits until all the specified executors terminate or the given timeout elapses or the current thread gets interrupted. In case the current thread gets interrupted, this method returns immediately and keeps the interrupted status of the thread.
        Parameters:
        timeout - the maximum time to wait for the executors to terminate in the given time unit. This argument must be greater than or equal to zero.
        timeunit - the time unit of the timeout argument. This argument cannot be null.
        executors - the executors to wait to be terminated. This argument cannot be null and cannot contain null elements.
        Returns:
        true if the specified executors have terminated, false if the timeout expired or the current got interrupted before the executors terminated
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - thrown if the specified timeout value is lower than zero
        java.lang.NullPointerException - thrown if the timeunit argument or the specified executor array or one of the executors is null
        See Also:
        awaitTerminateExecutors(long, TimeUnit, ExecutorService[])

      • awaitTerminateExecutors

        public static void awaitTerminateExecutors(java.util.concurrent.ExecutorService... executors)
                                    throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Waits until all the specified executors terminate or the current thread gets interrupted. In case the current thread gets interrupted, this method will throw an InterruptedException and clear the interrupted status of the thread.
        Parameters:
        executors - the executors to wait to be terminated. This argument cannot be null and cannot contain null elements.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - thrown if the current thread was interrupted before all the specified executor has terminated
        java.lang.NullPointerException - thrown if the specified executor array is null or one of the executors is null
        See Also:
        awaitTerminateExecutorsSilently(ExecutorService[])

      • awaitTerminateExecutors

        public static boolean awaitTerminateExecutors(long timeout,
                              java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit timeunit,
                              java.util.concurrent.ExecutorService... executors)
                                       throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Waits until all the specified executors terminate or the given timeout elapses or the current thread gets interrupted. In case the current thread gets interrupted, this method will throw an InterruptedException and clear the interrupted status of the thread.
        Parameters:
        timeout - the maximum time to wait for the executors to terminate in the given time unit. This argument must be greater than or equal to zero.
        timeunit - the time unit of the timeout argument. This argument cannot be null.
        executors - the executors to wait to be terminated. This argument cannot be null and cannot contain null elements.
        Returns:
        true if the specified executors have terminated before the given timeout expired, false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - thrown if the current thread was interrupted before all the specified executor has terminated or the given timeout expired
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - thrown if the specified timeout value is lower than zero
        java.lang.NullPointerException - thrown if the timeunit argument or the specified executor array or one of the executors is null
        See Also:
        awaitTerminateExecutorsSilently(long, TimeUnit, ExecutorService[])
